articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits Wen Jiabao at State Guest House
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits Wen Jiabao at State Guest House
Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the state guest house for Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK and received him on Monday.
					 Present there were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and other suite members. 
					
					 Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yang Gon, department director of the Central Committee of the WPK, and Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, were present there. 
					
					  On the occasion Wen Jiabao conveyed the greetings of Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the CPC and president of the PRC, to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il once again extended congratulations on the 60th birthday of the PRC before asking Wen to convey his regards to Hu Jintao. He had a sincere talk with Wen Jiabao on the issue of boosting the DPRK-China friendship and a series of matters of mutual concern.
					
					  Kim Jong Il pointed out as regards the issue of denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula:
					
					  The denuclearization of the peninsula was the behest of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					  The hostile relations between the DPRK and the United States should be converted into peaceful ties through the bilateral talks without fail. 
					
					  We expressed our readiness to hold multilateral talks, depending on the outcome of the DPRK-U.S. talks. The six-party talks are also included in the multilateral talks. 
					
					  Our efforts to attain the goal of denuclearizing the peninsula remain unchanged. 
					
					  The talk proceeded in a cordial and friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Hosts Dinner for Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Hosts Dinner for Wen Jiabao
Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il hosted a dinner in honor of Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK at the Paekhwawon State Guest House in the evening of Monday.
					 Present there on invitation were Wen Jiabao, Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and other suite members.
					
					 Present there were Jang Song Thaek and Kim Yang Gon, department directors of the WPK Central Committee, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
					
					 Kim Jong Il made a toast at the dinner.
					
					 Then Wen Jiabao made a toast.
					
					 The dinner proceeded in an amicable atmosphere overflowing with friendship from its beginning to its end.
					
					 At the end of the dinner Kim Jong Il said goodbye to Wen Jiabao.
					
					 Wen expressed profound thanks to Kim Jong Il for having accorded him cordial hospitality during his visit.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Wen Jiabao
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Monday received gifts from Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.
					 Present there were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and other suite members.
					
					 Wen Jiabao explained the gifts to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed thanks for them and looked round the gifts on display.

articles.title: "Year of DPRK-China Friendship" Closed and Extravaganza "Arirang" Performed
articles.content:
"Year of DPRK-China Friendship" Closed and Extravaganza "Arirang" Performed
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- A closing ceremony of the "year of DPRK-China friendship" which was opened to significantly mark the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and China and the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" were given with splendor at the May Day Stadium in the evening.
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il together with Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, attended the closing ceremony and watched extravaganza "Arirang".
					
					 Present there were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and other suite members, staff members of the Chinese embassy here, Chinese guests staying in the DPRK and Chinese students.
					
					Also present there were Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Jong Gak, member of the NDC of the DPRK and first vice-director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, Kim Il Chol, member of the NDC of the DPRK and first vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, and leading officials of party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, officials in the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media, servicepersons and working people in the city.
					
					 Speeches were made at the closing ceremony.
					
					 Kim Yong Il said: Since the establishment of diplomatic relations the peoples of the two countries have closely supported and cooperated in all fields of politics, military, economy and culture, weathering together all sorts of trials and tempests of history. This has made a positive contribution to encouraging socialist construction in the two countries and ensuring peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Noting that the DPRK-China friendship is growing stronger at a new higher level under the deep care of Kim Jong Il and Hu Jintao, he stated that the historic "year of DPRK-China friendship" which was formally declared by the top leaders of the two countries offered an opportunity to re-confirm the importance of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties, two countries and two peoples which were forged and have grown stronger in the struggle for accomplishing their common cause and lay a solid foundation for carving out more beautiful future of DPRK-China friendship generation after generation. 
					
					 It is the unshakable will of the WPK and the DPRK government to invariably consolidate and develop the DPRK-China friendship generation after generation, he said, stressing that the Korean people would as ever make every possible effort hand in hand with the Chinese people to expand and develop the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations. 
					
					   Wen Jiabao said that he was very pleased to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between China and the DPRK and hold a closing ceremony of the "year of Sino-DPRK friendship" together with Korean comrades.
					
					He extended sincere salute and beautiful best wishes to the government and people of the DPRK and wholehearted thanks to all the participants on behalf of the government and people of China.
					
					 Multifarious exchanges and celebration events held between the two countries helped the peoples of the two countries promote the friendship between them and boost the friendly cooperation in all  fields, he said, adding that this injected fresh energy into the development of the Sino-DPRK relations. 
					
					 The Chinese side together with the DPRK side will consolidate and develop the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship and boost the cooperation and exchange and thus make a bigger contribution to bringing greater happiness to the peoples of the two countries and protecting the regional peace and stability.
					
					 The closing ceremony was followed by grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", winner of "Kim Il Sung Prize." 
					
					 At the end of "Arirang" the performers presented a chapter of friendship reflecting the strong will and desire of the peoples of the two countries to boost the traditional DPRK-China friendship generation after generation.
					
					 As the performance was over, the performers and audience broke into cheers of "hurrah!" shaking the stadium and fireworks were displayed to beautifully decorate the nocturnal sky of the capital city. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il and Wen Jiabao warmly waved back to the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Wen Jiabao
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly conversation with Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him. 
					 Kim referred to the fact that Wen Jiabao visited the DPRK at an important time when the DPRK and China are working out brilliant future, summing up the 60 year-long history of friendship and cooperation between them.
					
					 He stressed that it is the consistent stand of the WPK and the DPRK government to value the DPRK-China friendship and invariably strengthen and develop it. 
					
					Wen Jiabao expressed thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for having greeted him and other Chinese guests at the airport.
					
					 He also referred to the fact that the two countries have dynamically stepped up socialist construction, supporting and cooperating with each other after the establishment of diplomatic ties between them. 
					
					 He noted that it is the moral obligation toward the leaders of the elder generation and responsibility before the new generation to steadily consolidate and develop the traditional Sino-DPRK friendly relations, the common wealth of the two peoples. 
					
					 Present there were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army. 
					
					 On hand were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China.

articles.title: Banquet Given to Welcome Chinese Premier and Mark Anniversary of DPRK-China Diplomatic Ties
articles.content:
Banquet Given to Welcome Chinese Premier and Mark Anniversary of DPRK-China Diplomatic Ties
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Cabinet of the DPRK gave a banquet at the People's Palace of Culture Sunday to welcome Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK, and mark the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and China. 
					 Present at the banquet on invitation were Wen Jiabao, Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and other suite members and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Il, premier of the Cabinet, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Yong Ho, chief secretary of the Cabinet Secretariat, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, and officials concerned.
					
					 Toasts were exchanged at the banquet.
					
					 Kim Yong Il said Premier Wen Jiabao and his party are paying a visit to the DPRK on the important occasion of reviewing the 60 year-long history of the DPRK-China friendship and carving out a future. 
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK-China friendship deeply rooted in the hearts of the peoples of the two countries would be invariable despite the flow of time.
					
					 Wen Jiabao said:
					
					 The Sino-DPRK relations of friendship and cooperation have grown stronger in recent years, recalling that the Sino-DPRK friendship is a common precious treasure provided by revolutionaries of the elder generation of the two countries.
					
					 The two countries have demonstrated before the world the Sino-DPRK relations favorably developing as the days go by through the colorful celebrations of the "year of the Sino-DPRK friendship", the 60th anniversary of the establishment of the bilateral diplomatic ties.
					
					 It is the consistent policy of the Chinese party and government to set store by the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship and steadily boost the bilateral relations of good neighborliness, friendship and cooperation, he noted, declaring that China would strive together with Korean comrades to steadily deepen and develop the exchange and cooperation in all fields in the spirit of "inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation".

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV 
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK laid a wreath before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province, on Monday. 
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony with him were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, other suite members, staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK. 
					
					 They were accompanied by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China.
					
					 A wreath in the name of Wen Jiabao was placed before the cemetery. 
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the CPV.
					
					 Wen Jiabao laid a bouquet before the grave of Mao Anying and looked round the cemetery and graves of fallen fighters.
					
					 After visiting the former CPV Command he in the visitor's book wrote that the feats performed by the CPV will shine long in history.
					
					 He presented a souvenir to the county.

articles.title: Joint Art Performance Given by Korean and Chinese Artistes
articles.content:
Joint Art Performance Given by Korean and Chinese Artistes
  Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- A joint art performance was given by the Mansudae Art Troupe and the Chinese art troupe at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Monday in celebration of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and China and the "year of the DPRK-China friendship". 
					 It was appreciated by Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, 
					
					Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet who doubles as chairman of the State Planning Commission, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Yong Ho, chief secretary of the Cabinet Secretariat, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, officials concerned, servicepersons and working people in the city. 
					
					 Also among the audience were Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK, Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and other suite members, staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chine
					
					 se guests staying in the DPRK. 
					
					 Put on the stage were chorus "General on a Galloping White Horse", female solo and chorus "Oh, My Motherland of Songun" and dance "Fly High, Doves" performed by Korean artistes and mixed duet "I Love China", national dance "Yellow River" and artistic acrobatics prepared by Chinese artistes and other colorful numbers. 
					
					 Korean artistes successfully presented mixed duet of Chinese song "I Love My Chinese Nation" and Chinese artistes sang well Korean song "The Blue Sky over My Country", impressing the audience.
					
					 The Song "DPRK-China Friendship Will Be Everlasting" resounded forth on the stage while a beautiful dance was presented there.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets Chinese Party and State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Greets Chinese Party and State Leaders
Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il together with Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Kim Yong Il, premier of the Cabinet, Monday sent a message of greetings to Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, president of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the PRC, Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council of the PRC, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the PRC.
					 The message said:
					
					 We extend warm congratulations and friendly greetings to you and, through you, to the Communist Party of China, the government and people of the PRC on behalf of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and the PRC.
					
					 The establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and the PRC was an epochal event as it helped comprehensively develop the long-standing friendly relations between the two countries on a new higher stage.
					
					 Over the past six decades since the establishment of diplomatic ties the two countries have steadily consolidated and developed the bonds of friendship while closely supporting and cooperating with each other in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields. This has greatly contributed to encouraging socialist construction in the two countries and ensuring peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Our two countries are significantly celebrating this year after setting it as the "year of DPRK-China friendship".
					
					 We are convinced that the "year of DPRK-China friendship" is marking a significant occasion in reviewing the shining six decades of friendship and cooperation, designing more beautiful future and powerfully demonstrating the invariable vitality of the traditional DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 Consistent is the stand of our party and government of the Republic to strengthen generation after generation the DPRK-China friendship, the precious common wealth handed down to us by the revolutionaries of the elder generation of our two countries.
					
					 In the belief that the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations would steadily grow stronger thanks to the concerted efforts of the parties, governments and peoples of the two countries, we sincerely hope that the Chinese people will register greater successes in the future in the work to build a harmonious socialist society based on the scientific view on development under the leadership of the CPC with Hu Jintao as general secretary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Greetings from Chinese Party and State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Greetings from Chinese Party and State Leaders
Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Kim Yong Il, premier of the Cabinet, received a message of greetings from Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, president of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the PRC Central Military Commission, Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council, on Monday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
					 The message said:
					
					 We, on behalf of the CPC and the Chinese government and people, extend warm congratulations to you, and through you, to the WPK, the DPRK government and the fraternal Korean people on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the PRC and the DPRK.
					
					 The establishment of bilateral diplomatic ties was an important event of epoch-making significance in the history of the relations between the two countries and marked the beginning of bilateral friendly relations.
					
					 The traditional Sino-DPRK friendship stood the test of the changing complicated international situation and the Sino-DPRK good-neighborly, friendly and cooperative relations have steadily grown strong thanks to the concerted efforts of the two sides over the last six decades.
					
					 Both sides have had a frequent exchange of visits at various levels and briskly cooperated with each other in various fields and maintained adjustment and cooperation in the international and regional issues.
					
					 The history proves that the development of the Sino-DPRK relations is in line with the fundamental interests and common desire of the two peoples and is favorable for defending the regional peace and stability, too.
					
					 The party, the government and the people of China attach utmost importance to the further development of the Sino-DPRK good-neighborly, friendly and cooperative relations under the new situation.
					
					 We will strive together with the Korean side to steadily develop the Sino-DPRK relations of good-neighborliness, friendship and cooperation provided and fostered by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries in the spirit of "inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation".
					
					 We sincerely wish the DPRK prosperity. 
					
					 We wholeheartedly wish to see the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship steadily grow strong.

articles.title: Greetings to Foreign Minister of China
articles.content:
Greetings to Foreign Minister of China
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Monday sent a message of greetings to Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs of China, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and China.
					 The message said that this year the two countries are powerfully demonstrating the vitality of the bilateral friendship that has stood all sorts of trials of history over the past six decades, while having significant joint celebrations of the "year of DPRK-China friendship."
					
					 Hoping that the cooperation between the foreign ministries of the two countries for the development of the traditional DPRK-China friendly relations would continue to be boosted in the days ahead, the message wished the Chinese people greater success in the work to build a socialist state with Chinese characteristics.

articles.title: DWUK Officials Meet with WIDF Delegation
articles.content:
DWUK Officials Meet with WIDF Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place between officials of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) and members of the delegation of the Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF) in Pyongyang on Monday.
					 On hand were officials of the Central Committee of the DWUK including its Vice-Chairwoman Kim Kyong Ok and Marcia de Campos Pereira, president of the WIDF who is heading its delegation, and her companion.
					
					 The participants talked with each other about activities conducted by the women's organization of the DPRK and the WIDF and successes and experience gained by them in the past.

articles.title: Hollows Belonging to Neolithic Era Excavated
articles.content:
Hollows Belonging to Neolithic Era Excavated
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Archaeological Institute under the Academy of Social Sciences of the DPRK has discovered two relics of hollows in the Phyodae archaeological site (discovered in 1994), Honam-ri, Samsok District of Pyongyang, where lots of house sites and installations belonging to the Neolithic era are concentrated.
					 The hollows were dug out at southwest and northeast ends of position No. 7 of the Phyodae archaeological site. The hollow in the southwest place is called No. 1 and that in the northeast place is called No. 2.
					
					 Hollow No. 1 is 1.5 to 2 meters in diameter and 35 centimeters in depth. The inclination angle of its wall is some 40 degrees.
					
					 Unearthed in the hollow were pieces of patterned vessels, grinding stone and net sinker tantamount to nearly 45 items.
					
					 Most of the patterned vessel pieces have patterns of fir leaves. Among them are pieces of vessels with short oblique line patterns and a piece of vessel with lightning pattern.
					
					 Hollow No. 2 is nearly circle whose diameter is about 3 meters and depth is about 0.5 meter in the center.
					
					 Excavated in the hollow were pieces of 500-600 earthenware, hammer, foundation of grinding stone, polishing stone, axe, arrowhead and net sinker and large pieces of charcoal.
					
					 The newly discovered hollows are precious ones for the study of the cultured community life of people in the Pyongyang area during the Neolithic era.

articles.title: Plunder of Industrial Crops by Japanese Imperialists
articles.content:
Plunder of Industrial Crops by Japanese Imperialists
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists committed such indelible crimes as plundering large quantities of Korean resources and treasures during their 40-odd-year-long colonial rule over Korea.
					 Their pillage of industrial crops in Korea was a hideous crime unprecedented in any other colonies in its gangster-like nature and shamelessness.
					
					 They robbed Korea of tobacco, cotton and various other industrial crops, to say nothing of grain.
					
					 For this purpose, they cooked up various evil laws to seize the rights to cultivation, production and purchase of the industrial crops and strictly control it.
					
					 They directed primary attention to the pillage of cotton.  They worked out predatory plans such as "First Plan for the Encouragement of Cotton Cultivation" in 1912 and "Second Plan for the Encouragement of Cotton Cultivation" in 1919. And they mobilized even police to force cotton cultivation upon peasants irrespective of their will and stamped mercilessly the budding crops if they refused to meet their demand.
					
					 And they pursued a policy of exploiting industrial crops in a cunning way with the distribution of the products as a lever.
					
					 Through various exploiting systems, they carried away 34 percent of cotton output in the 1920s and over 80 percent in the 1930s. They purchased the cotton produced with much manpower at the price less than 18 percent of the world market price. To make matters worse, they plundered only quality cotton through the strict quality "appraisal".
					
					 From the end of 1930s, they openly deprived the peasants of cotton without paying its price through the "delivery system". The same predatory method was applied to tobacco and other industrial crops, too.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists' vicious pillage of industrial crops deformed the agricultural production structure of Korea, worsening the living conditions of the Korean peasants and the poverty in the countryside.
					
					 Japan should feel responsibility for it and make reparation for all the crimes at an early date.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Dedicate Themselves to Reunification Movement
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Dedicate Themselves to Reunification Movement
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- All Koreans in the north and the  south and abroad should put spurs to the grand march for independent reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself" and thus fulfill their duties for accomplishing the national cause of building a reunified and prosperous power on this land, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 They should turn out as one to accomplish without fail the historic cause of the country's reunification by staking their destiny on it.
					
					 It is the due obligation and noblest duty of the members of the Korean nation to achieve the country's reunification. Without achieving national reunification one cannot claim one has fulfilled one's duty before the country and the nation.
					
					 Reunification alone is a way out for the Korean nation. All Koreans should dedicate themselves to the struggle for national reunification.  This is the way for the Koreans to perform their duties and tasks before the country and the nation and a genuine patriotic road of exalting the dignity and sovereignty of the nation and achieving development and prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 All Koreans who love the country and the nation and are concerned about the destiny of the country and the nation, be they in the north and the south and abroad, should turn out as one in the sacred movement for the country's reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself" irrespective of ideology and ism, religious belief, political view and class and stratum.
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration serve as the great programmes for independent reunification common to the nation and the immortal banners.
					
					 Nothing is more worthwhile and proud than to wage the movement for the country's reunification with ardent patriotic desire in the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 Those contributing to national reunification will be loved and respected by the nation and recorded in the history of the nation as pro-reunification patriots.

articles.title: Story about Foxtail Millet Field Covered with Snow
articles.content:
Story about Foxtail Millet Field Covered with Snow
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- A unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by President Kim Il Sung was marching near Qingfeng in west Jiandao in spite of critical food shortage in early January, Juche 28 (1939).
					 One day the guerrillas unexpectedly found out an unharvested field of foxtail millet in a deep mountain.
					
					 His men were delighted to find the ripe ears of foxtail millet in the snow. But the President only smiled meaningfully.
					
					 In fact the foxtail millet field had a moving story.
					
					 A KPRA unit led by the President had passed by the field in the previous spring. At the sight of his men, a man who was sowing seeds there ran away, taking them for mountain bandits or Japanese troops.
					
					 The President writes in his reminiscences "With the Century":
					
					 My men had been very sorry to see the owner of the field running away. We thought he might not come back because he was so scared, so we planted foxtail millet there. We felt we should not leave the field to lie fallow for a year, but sow seeds on behalf of the owner, who had run away because of us, so that he might have something to harvest in autumn.
					
					 Later the owner came back to the field and was so grateful to the guerrillas that he left the foxtail millet crops in the field without harvesting for them.
					
					 This legend-like story was created as President Kim Il Sung always worked for the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il visita residencia de Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il visita residencia de Wen Jiabao
 Pyongyang, 5 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio en audiencia el dia 5 a Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, quien realiza la visita oficial y de amistad a Corea, en su residencia.
					  En esta ocasion participaron el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi, el embajador chino en Corea Liu Xiaoming y otros acompanantes.
					
					  Tambien, estuvieron presentes el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju, el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC Kim Yang Gon y el vicecanciller Kim Yong Il.
					
					  En la ocasion el premier chino Wen Jiabao transmitio al Dirigente Kim Jong Il el saludo de Hu Jintao, Secretario General del CC del PCCh y Presidente de la RPCh.
					
					  El Dirigente volvio a felicitar el 60o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPCh y transmitio el saludo a Hu Jintao.
					
					  Y departio sinceramente con el premier chino sobre el problema de fortalecer mas la amistad Corea-China y una serie de asuntos de interes mutuo. 
					
					  En cuanto al problema de la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana el Dirigente senalo como sigue:
					
					  La desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana  es el legado del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					  Las relaciones hostiles entre la RPDC y EE.UU. deben convertirse sin falta en las pacificas mediante las conversaciones bilaterales.
					
					  Expresamos nuestra voluntad de efectuar las conversaciones multilaterales despues de observar el resultado de las negociaciones RPDC-EE.UU. En las conversaciones multilaterales esta incluida la cita a 6 bandas.
					
					  Son invariables nuestros esfuerzos por realizar el objeto de la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  La charla se desarrollo en el ambiente cordial y amistoso.

articles.title: Acto de clausura de "Ano de amistad Corea-China" y funcion "Arirang"
articles.content:
Acto de clausura de "Ano de amistad Corea-China" y funcion "Arirang"
Pyongyang, 5 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar solemnemente el dia 5 por la noche en el capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo el acto de clausura del "Ano de amistad Corea-China" inaugurado para conmemorar significativamente el 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas Corea-China y la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang".
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, participo en el acto de clausura de dicho "Ano" y presencio la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang" junto con Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi, el embajador chino en Corea Liu Xiaoming y otros acompanantes, los miembros de la embajada china en Corea, los huespedes chinos que permanecen en Corea y los estudiantes chinos. 
					
					Participaron tambien el premier del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC Kim Yong Il, el vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Kim Yong Chun, el miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea Kim Jong Gak, el miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Kim Il Chol, los secretarios del CC del PTC Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC Yang Hyong Sop, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros y presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion Ro Tu Chol, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Pak Ui Chun, el ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su, el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju, el ministro de Salud Publica y presidente del CC de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China Choe Chang Sik, el embajador coreano acreditado en China Choe Jin Su, los funcionarios directivos de los organos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las organizaciones de masas, los ministerios e instituciones centrales, los funcionarios de los dominios de ciencia, ecuacion, cultura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion, oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					  En el acto de clausura hubo discursos.
					
					  El premier Kim Yong Il dijo que despues del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas los pueblos de los dos paises han venido apoyandose y cooperando estrechamente en todos los dominios de la politica, los asuntos militares, la economia y la cultura, lo cual contribuyo activamente a estimular e impulsar la construccion socialista en ambos paises y preservar la paz y la seguridad en Asia y el resto del mundo.
					
					  Prosiguio que hoy, la amistad Corea-China se desarrolla mas en la nueva altura bajo la profunda atencion del respetado camarada Kim Jong Il y el estimado camarada Hu Jintao.
					
					  Agrego que mediante el historico "Ano de amistad Corea-China" proclamado oficialmente por los maximos dirigentes de los dos paises fue reafirmada la importancia de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos, dos paises y dos pueblos que se establecieron y han venido fortaleciendose en la lucha por la causa comun y fue preparada la firme base capaz de preparar de generacion en generacion el futuro mas hermoso de la amistad Corea-China.
					
					  El PTC y el gobierno de la RPDC tienen la firme voluntad de consolidar invariablemente generacion tras generacion la amistad Corea-China, menciono y enfatizo que como lo hizo en el pasado en el futuro  tambien el pueblo coreano hara ingentes esfuerzos junto con el pueblo chino por ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China.
					
					  El premier chino Wen Jiabao dijo que se siente muy alegre por celebrar el 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas China-Corea y realzar el acto de clausura del "Ano de amistad China-Corea" junto con los camaradas coreanos.
					
					  Subrayo que en representacion del gobierno y el pueblo de China envia el saludo sincero y la felicitacion hermosa al gobierno y el pueblo de Corea y expresa de todo corazon el sincero agradecimiento a todos los participantes.
					
					  Diversos intercambios y actividades festivas efectuados entre los dos paises fomentaron la amistad entre los pueblos de los dos paises y fortalecieron la cooperacion amistosa en todos los dominios dando nuevo animo al desarrollo de las relaciones China-Corea.
					
					  Junto con la parte coreana, la china consolidara y desarrollara la tradicional amistad China-Corea y ampliara la cooperacion y el intercambio para ofrecer la mayor felicidad a los pueblos de ambos paises y hacer mayor aporte a preservar la paz y la estabilidad de la region.
					
					  Terminado el acto de clausura se ofrecio la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang", laureada con el Premio Kim Il Sung.  
					
					  En la ultima parte de la funcion los ejecutantes desplegaron el acto de amistad que refleja la firme voluntad y la aspiracion de ambos pueblos de consolidar de generacion en generacion la tradicional amistad Corea-China.
					
					  Terminada la funcion, las aclamaciones de "!Viva!" estremecieron la tierra y el cielo y se tiraron las salvas adornando hermosamente el cielo nocturno de la capital. 
					
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el premier chino Wen Jiabao respondieron cordialmente a las entusiastas aclamaciones de los ejecutantes y las masas.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il felicita a dirigentes chinos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il felicita a dirigentes chinos
Pyongyang, 5 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, junto con el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Kim Yong Nam y el premier del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Il, envio este lunes el mensaje de felicitacion a Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Presidente de la Republica Popular China y de la Comision Militar Central de la RPCh, a Wu Bangguo, presidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Nacional y a Wen Jiabao, primer ministro del Consejo de Estado, en ocasion del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre Corea y China.
					La misiva senala:
					
					En ocasion del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la RPDC y la RPCh, a nombre del PTC, el gobierno y el pueblo de la RPDC enviamos a ustedes y, por sus conductos, al PCCh, el gobierno y el pueblo de la RPCh la calurosa felicitacion y el saludo amistoso.
					
					El establecimiento de estas relaciones entre Corea y China fue un evento trascendental que permitio desarrollar globalmente en nueva y alta etapa las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises que tienen la larga historia.
					
					Durante estos 60 anos posteriores al establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas, Corea y China han seguido consolidando y desarrollando los lazos de amistad apoyandose y cooperando estrechamente en  todos los dominios incluyendo la politica, los asuntos militares, la economia y la cultura, lo cual estimulo e impulso la construccion socialista en los dos paises y contribuyo grandemente a preservar la paz y la seguridad de Asia y el resto del mundo.
					
					Nuestros dos paises definieron el ano presente como el "Ano de amistad Corea-China" y lo celebran significativamente.
					
					Estamos convencidos de que el "Ano de amistad Corea-China" sirve de un motivo significativo para hacer balance sobre los orgullosos 60 anos de la amistad y cooperacion, proyectar el futuro mas hermoso y poner de pleno manifiesto la invariable vitalidad de tradicional amistad Corea-China.
					
					Es invariable la posicion del PTC y el gobierno de la RPDC de fortalecer y desarrollar de generacion en generacion la amistad Corea-China, precioso tesoro comun entregado por los revolucionarios de veterana generacion de los dos paises.
					
					Seguros que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China se consolidaran y se desarrollaran ininterrumpidamente gracias a los esfuerzos comunes de los partidos, los gobiernos y los pueblos de ambos paises, deseamos de todo corazon que bajo la direccion del PCCh encabezado por el Secretario General Hu Jintao, el pueblo chino logre mayores exitos en la construccion de la sociedad socialista armoniosa basada en la concepcion del desarrollo cientifico.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de felicitacion de dirigentes chinos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de felicitacion de dirigentes chinos
Pyongyang, 5 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, junto con el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Kim Yong Nam y el premier del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Il, recibio el mensaje de felicitacion que les dirigieran el dia 5 Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Presidente de la Republica Popular China y de la Comision Militar Central de la RPCh, el presidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Nacional Wu Bangguo y el primer ministro del Consejo de Estado Wen Jiabao en ocasion del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre China y Corea.
					La misiva senala:
					
					Con motivo del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la RPCh y la RPDC, felicitamos calidamente en representacion del PCCh, el gobierno y el pueblo de China a ustedes y por sus conductos, al PTC, al gobierno coreano y al hermano pueblo coreano.
					
					El establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre China y Corea fue un evento importante que tiene significado trascendental en la historia de las relaciones entre ambos paises y abrio la nueva pagina de las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises.
					
					Durante los 60 anos transcurridos, gracias a los esfuerzos comunes de ambas partes, la tradicional amistad China-Corea supero la prueba del cambio de la complicada situacion internacional y se consolidaron y se desarrollaron sin cesar las relaciones China-Corea de buena vecindad, amistad y cooperacion.
					
					Ambas partes estrecharon el intercambio de visitas de diversos niveles, activaron la cooperacion en varias ramas y mantuvieron la coordinacion y la cooperacion en los problemas internacionales y regionales.
					
					La historia demuestra que el desarrollo de las relaciones China-Corea conviene al interes fundamental y al anhelo comun de los pueblos de los dos paises y a la defensa de la paz y la estabilidad de la region.
					
					Bajo las circunstancias nuevas, el partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de China conceden gran importancia al mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de buena vecindad, amistad y cooperacion entre China y Corea.
					
					Nos esforzaremos junto con la parte coreana por desarrollar ininterrumpidamente las referidas relaciones, preparadas y cultivadas por los dirigentes de veterana generacion de ambos paises, conforme al espiritu de la "Sucesion de tradicion, la aspiracion al futuro, la buena vecindad y la amistad, el fortalecimiento de cooperacion".
					
					Deseamos de todo corazon la prosperidad de la RPDC.
					
					Formulamos sinceros votos por hacer que la tradicional amistad China-Corea se consolide y se desarrolle constantemente.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Wen Jiabao
						
Pyongyang, 5 de octubre (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 5 en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, Wen Jiabao, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.
					Kim Yong Nam senalo que Wen Jiabao realizo una visita a Corea en el tiempo importante que balancea la historia de 60 anos de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y proyecta un magnifico futuro.
					
					Apreciar la amistad Corea-China y consolidarla constantemente es la invariable posicion de nuestro partido y gobierno, concluyo.
					
					Wen Jiabao agradecio que el Secretario General Kim Jong Il acudio al aeropuerto para acoger a si mismos.
					
					Se refirio a que despues del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre China y Corea, ambos paises han venido acelerando con vigor la construccion del socialismo apoyandose y cooperando. 
					
					Destaco que consolidar y desarrollar de continuo las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion, tesoro comun de los pueblos de los dos paises es la obligacion moral sobre los dirigentes de vieja generacion de ambos paises y una responsabilidad a las generaciones venideras.
					
					Participaron en la ocasion el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el embajador chino en Corea Liu Xiaoming, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei y el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi.
					
					Tambien  estuvieron presentes alli el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok, el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Pak Kyong Son, el vicecanciller Kim Yong Il, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae y el embajador coreano en China Choe Jin Su.
